page.title: 05 Local People
page.content: Our interviewee has lived in our area since 1943.She has noticed quite a few changes.One of the largest changes has been a lot more traffic,especially lorries going to get weighed at a local factory where there is a weighbridge. She told us that about three months ago Cogley Wood was protected and fenced off so nobody could destroy the woodland or wildlife. She thinks the flood prevention scheme is a very good idea,and worth having it built. In her spare time she's been studying the history of Bruton and Eastrip,and is in the middle of writing a book about it.Her husband was a famous sculptor who died in 1976.
